1: In my distress I cried out to the Lord and he answered me.
2: I said,[c] “O Lord, rescue me[d] from those who lie with their lips[e] and those who deceive with their tongues.[f]
3: How will he severely punish you, you deceptive talker?[g]
4: Here's how![h] With the sharp arrows of warriors, with arrowheads forged over the hot coals.[i]
5: How miserable I am.[j] For I have lived temporarily[k] in Meshech; I have resided among the tents of Kedar.[l]
6: For too long I have had to reside with those who hate[m] peace.
7: I am committed to peace,[n] but when I speak, they want to make war.[o]
